STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 17, 2021
Mark Lambert
Good Will Farm Association Inc dba U.P. Kids
PO Box 428
Houghton, MI 49931
RE: License #: CB310282171
U.P. KIDS
P.O. Box 428
57 Huron Street
Houghton, MI 49931
Dear Mr. Lambert:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 09/09/2021.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Implementation Sustainability, and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days
from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
PLEASE SUBMIT YOUR CORRECTIVE ACTION PLAN VIA EMAIL TO
CLAUDIA TRIESTRAM AT triestramc@michigan.gov
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact Claudia Triestram
with any questions. Her number is Claudia Triestram, Area Manager at (616) 552-3662.
Sincerely,
Don Collier, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-5326
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
1
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and shall make a
licensing recommendation to the department at least 15
calendar days before the expiration date of the foster home
license.
Three of 3 foster home files reviewed had reevaluations which were completed less
than 15 calendar days before the expiration date of the foster home license.
The first foster home had a reevaluation dated 03/11/2021 and an expiration date of
03/17/2021 (6 days). The second had a reevaluation date of 12/29/2020 and an
expiration date of 12/26/2020 (past). The last foster home file had a reevaluation
date of 08/28/2020 and an expiration date of 09/09/2020 (12 days).
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(5) If an agency is no longer providing services to the child in a
foster home, then both of the following shall be documented
before a change in placement:
(a) A summary of the services provided during care up to the
time of the change in placement and the needs that remain to
be met.
Two of 2 closed foster care files reviewed did not have a summary of the services
and the needs that remain to be met.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
08/12/2020 RENEWAL, CAP Approved 09/01/2020
08/29/2019 INTERIM, CAP Approved 10/17/2019
4

R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(5) If an agency is no longer providing services to the child in a
foster home, then both of the following shall be documented
before a change in placement:
(b) Provision for any continuing services.
Two of 2 closed foster care files reviewed did not have provision for any continuing
services.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
08/12/2020 RENEWAL, CAP Approved 09/01/2020
08/29/2019 INTERIM, CAP Approved 10/17/2019
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Two of 18 service plans reviewed in 2 different foster care services cases had
Updated Service Plans which were beyond the 90-calendar day requirement of this
rule. One was 6 days beyond and the other was 4 days.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
008/29/2019 INTERIM, CAP Approved 10/17/2019
5

R 400.12421 Visitation and parenting time.
An agency shall have a policy regarding visitation and parenting
time that contains, at a minimum, all of the following:
(b) An agency social service worker shall visit the foster child
and the foster parent in the foster parent's home at least once
every month.
One of 5 foster care services files reviewed did not have a caseworker visit with the
child in November 2020.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
08/12/2020 RENEWAL, CAP Approved 09/01/2020
R 400.12511 Independent living contract.
(1) When an agency terminates its independent living services
for a youth, the agency shall document all of the following
information in the case record within 30 calendar days of
termination of its services:
(a) The reason for the termination.
(b) The youth's new location.
(c) A summary of the services provided during care and the
needs that remain to be met.
(d) Provision for any follow-up services.
(2) An agency shall ensure and document that each youth who
ends independent living is provided with all of the following:
(a) Basic information about health, housing,
counseling/mental health services, and emergency resources.
(b) A birth certificate.
(c) A social security card.
(d) The youth’s funds and personal property.
One of 1 closed independent living files reviewed did not have the above requirements
documented in MiSACWIS(Michigan Statewide Automated Child Welfare Information
System).
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
6

SRM 200 Fingerprints
All personnel, contractors, vendors, and external auditors who
have access to CW-CHRI are required to complete Security
Awareness Training (SAT). Training is available on the Learning
Management System (LMS) for MDHHS personnel and
contractors with access to LMS. Non-contracted agencies will
complete Fingerprint Security Awareness Training via the
MDHHS public licensing website.
SAT is required to be taken within six months of working in a
position with CW-CHRI access and every two years thereafter.
CPAs are responsible for ensuring that all personnel with CHRI
access completes SAT timely. DCWL field consultants will
monitor completion of SAT for all CPAs as part of the annual
licensing inspection.
One employee was hired in May 2020 and had her SRM 200 training in March 2021,
which was late and resigned in April 2021. Two current employees had SRM 200
training, but they did not complete the training within the required timeframes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Technical assistance was not required.
V. CONSULTATION
Consultation was not requested or required
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period which was approved on 09/01/2020 with
compliance as follows:
CPA308(1) Application submission
CPA326(1)(g) A copy of the foster parent /agency agreement
CPA708(1) written assessment of each child available for adoption within 60
days
7

CPA418(2)(b) Timeliness of Updated Service Plans
THIS IS A REPEAT VIOLATION.
CPA405(5)(a) Summary of services
THIS IS A REPEAT VIOLATION.
CPA405(5)(b) follow up services
THIS IS A REPEAT VIOLATION.
VII. CHIEF ADMINISTRATOR ASSESSMENT
The Chief Administrator Assessment was completed on 09/07/2021. It showed a
thorough review of foster care services files and adoption files and a corrective
action plan to resolve what he had found.
Interviews
The supervisor and foster care workers interviewed felt supported and are provided
the tools they need to perform their role.
VIII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
IX. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
September 16, 2021
________________________________________
Don Collier Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 16, 2021
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
